topic.title: Deploying Ceph Monitor Services on Dedicated Resource Nodes

body.p: In , the Ceph monitor service is installed on the controller nodes by default. But you can install the service on one or more dedicated resource nodes by modifying the cloud input model. If you want to deploy the monitor service as a dedicated resource node, then you must decide prior to the deployment of Ceph. does not support deployment transition. Once Ceph is deployed, you cannot migrate the monitor service from controller to dedicated resource nodes.

section.title: Prerequisite
section.p: The lifecycle manager must be set up before starting Ceph deployment. For more details on the installation of the lifecycle manager, see .

p.b: To Install the Ceph Monitor Service on Dedicated Resource Nodes

body.p:
Perform the following procedure to install the Ceph monitor on dedicated nodes:
Login to the lifecycle manager.
Ensure that your cloud definition (~/helion/examples/entry-scale-kvm-ceph/*) is placed in the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/ directory .
Remove the line - ceph-monitor from server-role: CONTROLLER-ROLE in the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file.
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml file to add monitor nodes:- name: mon resource-prefix: ceph server-role: MON-ROLE allocation-policy: strict mint-count:3 service-components: - ntp-client - ceph-monitorEnsure that the section is correctly indented.
Define the monitor resource. For instructions, see .
Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml file to define all the monitor nodes in the cloud. You must repeat this for each monitor node:- id: mon4 ip-addr: 192.168.10.11 role: MON-ROLE server-group: RACK3 nic-mapping: MY-2PORT-SERVER mac-addr: 8b:f6:9e:ca:3b:7a ilo-ip: 192.168.9.11 ilo-password: password ilo-user: admin Substitute the values in above sample, as per your environment, for each of the monitor nodes being added.
Commit your configuration:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>"
Run the following command:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml
To reimage all the nodes using PXE, run the following command:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml
Run the configuration processor:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Run the following playbook:
cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml
